poem:
"Morning Ode to the Solitary Sudoku Player"

Each grey line, a boundary of thought,
In the corner, camouflaged numbers lie waiting.
Within each form, a story is sought,
A ballet of digits - no pausing, no resting.
Come next week, all will be clear,
In the digital Observer, truth draws near.
Yet, today, we are alone with our puzzle,
Each solved cell, a silent, victorious shuffle.
